subject: Missing parts
description_text:
﻿
Hi I just received my pro x ultra from your AliExpress store

And I’m missing the mounting screws and risers for the heel plate

Invoice attached 




Sent from my iPhone

conversations.body_text: Also a faulty LED on the clutch pedal Sent from my iPhone

Hi Paul Cundell,     Did you purchase through Alibaba International or our AliExpress store? Could you please provide the order number? In addition, kindly share your contact name, shipping address, and phone number so that we can send you a replacement LED module.
My name Paul cundell 0413139271 41 Swanson st mango hill Australia Queensland 4509 Sent from my iPhone
Sent from my iPhone
Also the screws and mounts for the heal plate none in box Sent from my iPhone
Hi Paul Cundell,    Please take a photo of all the screw and accessory packs you received, and I will check them one by one to see if anything is missing.
See attached you will see in photo 3 I have temporarily fixed on the heal plate with what I have at home Still need these spacers and screws Sent from my iPhone

Hi Paul Cundell,  We sincerely apologize for missing the standoffs used to install the spacer plate. As we are currently on the National Day holiday, we will resume work on October 9th and will immediately send out the missing parts once we’re back. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

Thank you will this include the broken LED strip also with the standoffs?


Sent from my iPhone
Hi Paul Cundell,    Yes, we’ll include those in the replacement shipment.  Also, please check if the flat cable on the non-lighting side of the brake pedal has become loose.

Yes I have checked all that seems to be a brake in the strip so some lights are on and others off 




Sent from my iPhone
Hi Paul Cundell,  ​Please provide your AliExpress order number so we can check and assist you further.

I have it’s all in the emails here 

When will I get my parts?


Sent from my iPhone
Hi Paul Cundell,  Your order has been shipped. The logistics number is:YT2528300704989907. You can track it at this website https://www.17track.net/zh-cn.

Thanks I’m also having a problem now with the van pro haptics For some reason when they are activated they stay on untill they are activated again In sim hub they show they are not receiving a signal but they still are vibrating it’s not until sim hub send another signal it turns off Like they are getting stuck. Also it’s worse when using your simson manager It’s the new controller also so it’s not an emi issue everything has been working ok untill just recently Sent from my iPhone

Here is video What I have tested so far Different usb USB direct to pc Changed motors to see if same happens Unplugged all motors but one for testing Check Sim hub in race sim and same issue Unplugged and waited for awhile. Same issue Reinstalled driver Updated to new firmware came out tonight Uninstalled Simpson manager and reinstalled Now the controller is disconnecting from pc and I have to power cycle and unplug usb every 10 mins or so Sent from my iPhone

Also to note When I plug in power adapter it always sparks And when I power off my pc the leds stay on pedels Even if I unplug power it still being powered via usb And also whe the vam pro disconnect the pedels still work Conclusion, faulty poke delivery to vam pro or they going into some type of power fail safe mode or circuit protect Sent from my iPad

Hi Paul Cundell,  Please uninstall the old version from your computer, then reinstall version 2.1.2 and update the firmware. After the update, the device version should display as CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.3. If the issue still persists, please feel free to contact me.     https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download     When you plug in the 24V independent power supply, seeing a small spark is completely normal — it’s caused by the capacitors in the motor circuit charging. Please rest assured, this is a safe 24V power source with no risk or danger, and it won’t damage the controller. There’s also no need to frequently plug or unplug the power.  In addition, if the LEDs stay on after the computer is turned off, that’s because some motherboards continue to supply power to the USB ports even when shut down. This is part of the motherboard’s design, and the pedals cannot detect whether the PC is powered off.

I actually fixed it this way so not sure if the update you suggested also fixed it just so you know if this happens again Found on reddit First, update the software to SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 in the “Settings → Update” section. Then, in the Settings → Update interface, click Manual Firmware Update, navigate to the pedals-firmware folder → pedals folder, and select the proxultra.sfu file to update. This firmware will disable the 4th axis. After completing the update, please test again Sent from my iPhone
Hi Paul Cundell,    Please make sure to use version 2.1.2, otherwise clicking Revert will cause the RX axis to reset.

Hi I think I found a bug in your software when I customise my lighting. I get the strange 4th axis problem again where the shakers won’t turn off when I reset the firmware. The problem goes away until I change the lights again. Sent from my iPhone

Hi Paul Cundell,  Okay, the issue might be caused by the RX configuration not being cleared during the LED update, which overwrote the main control and activated the RX axis. Tomorrow, I will have our software team investigate this bug and fix it, then release an update. Thank you for your feedback.
